member.summary:
Initializes a new SDUFormattedString object with given string and initial CharacterFormat.
Format string definition is at documentation for member.

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.WrapLines(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Single)
member.summary: Adds newline characters to wrap lines to fit given width.
member.remarks:
This method adds characters into SDUFormattedString so every Position and Interval structures becomes invalid.
This method is called by StringDrawUtils to wrap lines to fit a rectangle.

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.WrapSingleLine(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Single,PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Interval,System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Adds newline characters into single line to make it fit given width.
member.remarks:
This function changes character numbers of SDUFormattedString so every user Position and Interval structures becomes invalid.
Also as we save positions of newly added newline characters, WrapSingleLine calls must go from left to right - to not damage previously saved positions.

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.DrawTrimmedLine(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.PointF,System.Single,PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Interval,PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.ParagraphFormat)
member.summary: Draws trimmed line with trimming specified in ParagraphFormat.Trimming.

member.summary: Sets out parameters with informations needed to trim the line correctly.

member.summary: Returns size of given line if it's drawn as trimmed.

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.DrawStringInRectangle(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.RectangleF,PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.ParagraphFormat)
member.summary: Draws string into specified rectangle using given ParagraphFormat.
member.remarks:
This is the 'main' method of the class. This one is called by StringDrawUtils to draw formatted string.
As this class (and consequently this method) isn't to be published, there are some limitations:
Angle of InitialFormat (specified at construction) has to be zero.
BackgroundBrush

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.DrawStringLineByLine(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.RectangleF,PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.ParagraphFormat)
member.summary:
This one draws string into given rectangle with even some more limitations than DrawStringInRectangle.
It should not be called from anywhere else than DrawStringInRectangle.

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position.#ctor(PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString)
member.summary: Initializes a new Position struct pointing to the first character of given parent SDUFormattedString object.

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position.#ctor(PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new Position struct pointing to specified position of given parent SDUFormattedString object.

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position.Begin(PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString)
member.summary: Returns a new Position struct pointing to the first character of given parent SDUFormattedString object.

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position.End(PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString)
member.summary: Returns a new Position struct pointing behind the last character of given parent SDUFormattedString object.

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position.IsEnd
member.summary: Returns true if this Position struct points at the end (ie. behind the last character).

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position.IsBeginning
member.summary: Returns true if this Position struct points at the first character.

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position.Next
member.summary: Moves the position struct one character further.
member.remarks: Of course this is not posible at the end of string, so in this case an exception is thrown. (Wanting to do this means there's some bug.)

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position.Back
member.summary: Moves the position struct one character backward.
member.remarks: Of course this is not posible at the beginning of string, so in this case an exception is thrown. (Wanting to do this means there's some bug.)

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position.op_Addition(PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the Position struct by characters forward (or -ofs backward, if ofs is negative).
member.returns: If moving out of the string margins would be result of this method, an exception is thrown. (Wanting to do this means there's some bug.)

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position.op_Subtraction(PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the Position struct by characters backward (or -ofs forward, if ofs is negative).
member.returns: If moving out of the string margins would be result of this method, an exception is thrown. (Wanting to do this means there's some bug.)

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position.op_Subtraction(PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position,PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position)
member.summary: Returns the number of characters between given Position objects. (Eg. (a+2)-a==2)

member.name: P:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position.Piece
member.summary: Index of piece in parent's array.

member.name: P:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position.Index
member.summary: Index of character in piece string.

member.name: P:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position.Parent
member.summary: SDUFormattedString object that this struct points into.

member.name: T:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Interval
member.summary: This struct can contain an interval in SDUFormattedString.
member.remarks:
The interval is represented as two positions - position of it's first character () and position of the first character not contained in this interval ().
If Start==End, the interval is empty.

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Interval.#ctor(PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position,PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position)
member.summary: Initializes a new Interval struct specified by gives starting and ending Position.
member.param: Fisrt character not in interval. ( (end-1) is the last character.)

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Interval.Full(PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString)
member.summary: Returns interval containing full parent SDUFormattedString.

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Interval.Split(PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Position,PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Interval@,PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.SDUFormattedString.Interval@)
member.summary: Splits interval at specified position.
member.param: Receives interval that starts the same as original and ends at given Position.
Receives Interval that starts at given Position and ends the same as original.

member.summary: Ending position of the interval. (End-1) is the last character of given interval.

member.summary: Length of Interval in characters.

member.summary: Summary description for Win32.

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.BitBlt(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Performs a bit-block transfer of the color data corresponding to a rectangle of pixels from the specified source device context into a destination device context.
member.param: Handle to the destination device context.
The leftmost x-coordinate of the destination rectangle (in pixels).
The topmost y-coordinate of the destination rectangle (in pixels).
The width of the source and destination rectangles (in pixels).
The height of the source and the destination rectangles (in pixels).
Handle to the source device context.
The leftmost x-coordinate of the source rectangle (in pixels).
The topmost y-coordinate of the source rectangle (in pixels).
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: T:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues
member.summary: Values to pass to the GetDCEx method.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.Window
member.summary: DCX_WINDOW: Returns a DC that corresponds to the window rectangle rather than the client rectangle.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.Cache
member.summary: DCX_CACHE: Returns a DC from the cache, rather than the OWNDC or CLASSDC window. Essentially overrides CS_OWNDC and CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.NoResetAttrs
member.summary: DCX_NORESETATTRS: Does not reset the attributes of this DC to the default attributes when this DC is released.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.ClipChildren
member.summary: DCX_CLIPCHILDREN: Excludes the visible regions of all child windows below the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.ClipSiblings
member.summary: DCX_CLIPSIBLINGS: Excludes the visible regions of all sibling windows above the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.ParentClip
member.summary: DCX_PARENTCLIP: Uses the visible region of the parent window. The parent's WS_CLIPCHILDREN and CS_PARENTDC style bits are ignored. The origin is set to the upper-left corner of the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.ExcludeRgn
member.summary: DCX_EXCLUDERGN: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is excluded from the visible region of the returned DC.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.IntersectRgn
member.summary: DCX_INTERSECTRGN: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is intersected with the visible region of the returned DC.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.ExcludeUpdate
member.summary: DCX_EXCLUDEUPDATE: Unknown...Undocumented

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.IntersectUpdate
member.summary: DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE: Unknown...Undocumented

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.LockWindowUpdate
member.summary: DCX_LOCKWINDOWUPDATE: Allows drawing even if there is a LockWindowUpdate call in effect that would otherwise exclude this window. Used for drawing during tracking.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.Validate
member.summary: DCX_VALIDATE When specified with DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE, causes the DC to be completely validated. Using this function with both DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE and DCX_VALIDATE is identical to using the BeginPaint function.

member.name: T:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.TernaryRasterOperations
member.summary: Specifies a raster-operation code. These codes define how the color data for the source rectangle is to be combined with the color data for the destination rectangle to achieve the final color.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.TernaryRasterOperations.SRCCOPY
member.summary: dest = source

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.TernaryRasterOperations.SRCPAINT
member.summary: dest = source OR dest

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.TernaryRasterOperations.SRCAND
member.summary: dest = source AND dest

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.TernaryRasterOperations.SRCINVERT
member.summary: dest = source XOR dest

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.TernaryRasterOperations.SRCERASE
member.summary: dest = source AND (NOT dest)

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.TernaryRasterOperations.NOTSRCCOPY
member.summary: dest = (NOT source)

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.TernaryRasterOperations.NOTSRCERASE
member.summary: dest = (NOT src) AND (NOT dest)

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.TernaryRasterOperations.MERGECOPY
member.summary: dest = (source AND pattern)

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.Win32.TernaryRasterOperations.MERGEPAINT
member.summary: dest = (NOT source) OR dest

member.name: T:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.CharacterFormat
member.summary: Specifies character formatting

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.CharacterFormat.Font
member.summary: Font to be used for drawing strings.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.CharacterFormat.Brush
member.summary: Brush to be used for drawing strings.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.CharacterFormat.Angle
member.summary: Angle of string's rotation. (Clockwise)

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.CharacterFormat.HotkeyPrefix
member.summary: HotkeyPrefix of the string.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.CharacterFormat.Formatted
member.summary: If true, some special sequences can be used in the string to change it's appearance.
member.remarks:
The formatting sequences are:
#CRRGGBB Changes color of the text. RR, GG and BB are hexadecimal values of appropriate color channels.
#C- Changes color of the text to the one before last use of #CRRGGBB command.
Can be used multiple times: #CFF0000 Red #C00FF00 Green #C0000FF Blue #C- Green #C- Red
#B+ and #B- Sets and unsets the bold font style.
#I+ and #I- Sets and unsets the italics font style.
#U+ and #U- Sets and unsets the underline font style.
## Writes the # character (as it is not possible to write it by '#' character).

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.CharacterFormat.FilledBounds
member.summary: Instead of characters, only bounding rectangles are drawn.
member.remarks: This is useful when resulting image is to be masked and at the same time text is drawn by several brushes.

member.name: F:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.CharacterFormat.IgnoreColorFormatting
member.summary: Color formattig marks will be ignored. (Applicable only when Formatted is true.)
member.remarks: This is useful when resulting image is to be used as mask and we want all the text to be drawn by same brush.

member.name: M:PureComponents.ActionSet.Common.RoundRectUtils.StrokeOutConvexRegion(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Region,System.Drawing.Color,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws one-pixel line around region border. As some optimalisations are used, the has to be convex - otherwise the line might be drawn incorrectly.
member.param: to stroke out. It has to be convex - otherwise result might be drawn incorrectly.
If true, pixels will be drawn inside the , otherwise outside.
member.remarks: The more rectangular shape of the region is, the faster will this method work. It goes through all noncontained pixels in bounding rectangle of specified region. (Because region is convex, we can easily skip the contained ones.)
